name: 嬰幼兒認知發展研究
description:
1. 瞭解嬰幼兒認知發展之涵義與重要議題 
2. 認識腦發展之新近研究方法與發現及其與嬰幼兒認知發展的關係 
3. 探討嬰幼兒認知發展重要層面之相關研究與發現認知科學取向關於嬰幼兒認知發展探究之方法與結果 
4. 針對嬰幼兒認知發展重要施測方式進行實地研究

syllabus:
How do infants and young children acquire knowledge about the world? This course will provide overview of children's understanding of the physical world, children’s ability of extracting and learning information from the world, children’s memory and attention, children’s ability to understand others’ mind, how being a bilingual affects children’s mind and brain, and how children’s brain is shaped by their daily experience.

The class is organized into two parts: Overview and Paper Discussion. For each topic, there will be a teacher’s lecture to guide students into this new topic (Overview), followed by one or two paper discussions led by students in turn (Paper Discussion). Students are expected to read and comment on these articles, to participate in weekly discussions, and complete a final term paper.

1\. Introduction to Course

2\. Overview of Infant Development - The Scientist In the Crib

3\. Exp. Paradigm - How Do We Know What Infants Know?

4\. Infancy - The Physical World

5\. How Children Acquire Knowledge - Statistical Learning

6\. Memory Development

7\. Attention Development

8\. Theory of Mind

9\. The Bilingual Minds

10.  How Experience Shapes Children’s Brain
